contentrichtext.text: {{Wiktionary|butler}} A '''[[butler]]''' is a domestic worker, generally in a large household and usually the senior male servant. '''Butler''' may also refer to: ==People== *[[Butler (surname)]], including list of people with the surname *[[Butler Ames]] (1871-1954), American politician, engineer, soldier and businessman *[[Butler Derrick]] (born 1936), former U.S. Representative from South Carolina *[[Butler B. Hare]] (1875-1967), U.S. Representative from South Carolina *[[Butler Lampson]] (born 1943), American computer scientist ==Places== In '''Antarctica''': *[[Butler Peaks]] *[[Butler Summit]] *[[Butler Glacier]] *[[Butler Passage]] *[[Butler Island]] *[[Butler Rocks]] *[[Butler Nunataks]] In '''Australia''': *[[Butler, Western Australia]] *[[Butler, South Australia]] In '''Canada''': *[[Butler Range]], a mountain range in British Columbia *[[Butler, Manitoba]] In '''New Zealand''': *[[Butler River]] In the '''United States''': *[[Butler, Alabama]] *[[Butler, California]] *[[Butler, Georgia]] *[[Butler, Illinois]] *[[Butler, Indiana]] *[[Butler, Kentucky]] *[[Butler, Maryland]] *[[Butler, Missouri]] *[[Butler, New Jersey]] *[[Butler, New York]] *[[Butler, Ohio]] *[[Butler, Oklahoma]] *[[Butler, Pennsylvania]] *[[Butler, South Dakota]] *[[Butler, Tennessee]] *[[Butler, Wisconsin (disambiguation)]] **[[Butler, Clark County, Wisconsin]] **[[Butler, Waukesha County, Wisconsin]] *[[Butler County, Alabama]] *[[Butler County, Iowa]] *[[Butler County, Kansas]] *[[Butler County, Kentucky]] *[[Butler County, Missouri]] *[[Butler County, Nebraska]] *[[Butler County, Ohio]] *[[Butler County, Pennsylvania]] *[[Butler Township (disambiguation)]] *[[Butler (MBTA station)]], Boston, Massachusetts *[[Lake Butler, Orange County, Florida]] *[[Lake Butler, Union County, Florida]] *[[Butler Valley (Arizona)]] *[[Fort Butler (disambiguation)]] *Camp Butler, original name of [[Camp Misery]], an American Civil War Union Army camp *[[Butler Farm]], Swedesboro, New Jersey, on the National Register of Historic Places In '''outer space''': *[[13543 Butler]], an asteroid ==Schools== *[[Butler University]], liberal arts university in Indianapolis, Indiana **[[Butler Bulldogs]], the athletic program of Butler University *[[Butler College]], one of the six residential colleges of Princeton University *[[Butler Community College]], El Dorado, Kansas *[[Butler High School (disambiguation)]] ==Titles== *[[Baron Butler]], a title created twice, once in the Peerage of Ireland and once in the Peerage of England *[[Butler baronets]], two baronetcies in the Baronetage of Ireland and two in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom ==Companies== *[[Butlers Chocolates]], an Irish-owned manufacturer of luxury chocolate and chocolate products *[[Butler International]], a defunct engineering services firm based in Fort Lauderdale, Florida *[[Butler Air Transport]], a defunct Australian company ==Other uses== *Hotel Butler, restaurant in [[Saugatuck, MI]] *[[Butler House (disambiguation)]], various buildings *[[Butler Hospital]], Providence, Rhode Island *[[Butler Hotel]], Seattle, Washington *[[Butler Block]], a building in Uxbridge, Massachusetts *[[Butler Library]], Columbia University *[[Butler Institute of American Art]], Youngstown, Ohio *[[Butler (software)]], automating application for Mac OS X *[[Butler Oscillator]], an electronic [[oscillator]] *The ''[[Butler Review]]'' *[[Butler scoring]], a scoring system used in [[contract bridge]] *[[Grand Butler of France]], a position in the Maison du Roi during the ancien regime *[[Butler (basketball)]], a team based in Butler, Ohio that played in the Central Basketball League in the 1906-07 season ==See also== *[[Butler Act]], a 1925 Tennessee law prohibiting public school teachers from denying the Biblical account of man's origin {{disambiguation|geo|given name}}
